content.text: How Fast Do You Accumulate Toxicity?
A Channeler in a typical combat (4-6 rounds):
Style Toxicity Gained Description
Conservative +3-4 2 Flickers + 1 Surge. Support role. Minimal risk.
Standard +5-8 1-2 Flickers/round + 2 Surges. Active caster. Meaningful contribution.
Aggressive +8-12 Flickers every round + Surges every round + 1 Torrent. You’re going hard.
Nuclear +12-20 Everything above + a Cataclysm. You’re ending the fight or ending yourself. ----------------------- ----------------------- -----------------------

Default toxicity max: 20. A Channeler with Grit 8 (+4 max) and Toxicity Filter (+2 max) has 26 max. Going aggressive for one fight costs \~10 toxicity = \~40% of their max. Two aggressive combats in one mission = 80%. One more and they’re at harvest threshold.

The math creates natural pacing. A Channeler CAN go nuclear every fight. They just can’t do it twice. The toxicity track self-regulates — you have to decide which fights deserve your full power and which you coast through with Flickers and your sidearm.
Toxicity vs Combat Effectiveness Curve
Tox % Casting Status The Decision
0-25%                   Full power. No          Easy. No tension. restrictions. Cast freely.
25-50%                  Still effective.        Do you keep casting or Scanner flags. Skin     switch to weapons? glows.
50-70%                  Involuntary discharges. Every spell risks Interface penalty.      collateral. Team asks “are you sure?“
70-85%                  Allies gain toxicity    The team is paying for from proximity. -1 all  your power. Is it worth checks.                 it?
85-100%                 Maximum power but       You’re a weapon. Are extraction teams are    you still a person? hunting you. ----------------------- ----------------------- -----------------------

The Channeler who stays below 50% is a reliable team member. The Channeler who pushes past 70% is a liability who also happens to be the most dangerous thing in the room. That tension is the entire class fantasy.
